title: LG Electronics to unveil AI home robot LG CLOiD at CES 2026
description: South Korean technology giant LG Electronics Inc. is set to debut its next-generation artificial intelligence home robot, LG CLOiD, at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) starting Tuesday in Las Vegas, United States, as per a report by Pulse, the English service of Maeil Business News Korea.

title: The Future Is Here: AI-Generated Police Report Claims Officer Turned into Frog
description: In an embarrassing incident highlighting the pitfalls of relying on artificial intelligence in law enforcement, the police department in Heber City, Utah, was forced to explain why a police report generated by AI claimed a responding officer had transformed into a frog.

title: InvestIQ Launches AI Trading Bot With 91% Historical Signal Accuracy for South African Traders
description: Cape Town, South Africa – InvestIQ has announced the rollout of its AI-driven trading bot, designed to deliver data-driven trading signals to South African traders. The platform is available at www.invest-iq.info and is positioned as an analytical and educational solution that uses artificial intelligence to assess financial markets and highlight potential trading opportunities. title: Samsung to double AI mobile devices to 800 million units
description: Samsung Electronics plans to double this year the number of its mobile devices with "Galaxy AI" features largely powered by Google's Gemini, its co-CEO said, which would give the US firm an edge over rivals as the global race in artificial intelligence heats up.

title: Australian shares end flat as miners counter energy, consumer losses
description: Australian shares ended Monday flat. Iron ore miners saw gains, while consumer discretionary and energy stocks declined. Trading volumes were notably low. Asian markets, however, experienced a significant surge, reaching record highs driven by artificial intelligence optimism. Australian equities did not mirror this trend. Miners climbed, while energy stocks reversed earlier gains. Interest rate-sensitive sectors faced pressure.
